rule: Same elastane percentage = completely different stretch in woven vs knit. Getting this wrong produces 200-400% errors.
interaction_with_fit: Determines cling threshold at every body zone. Most competitors treat elastane as single property.

rule: Same GSM, different fiber = different perceived weight/stiffness. Cotton feels 15% heavier than poly; silk 15% lighter.
scoring_formula: effective_gsm = gsm_estimated * fiber_multiplier. cotton:1.15, polyester:1.00, silk:0.85, wool:1.10, rayon:0.90, linen:1.25, nylon:0.95, tencel:0.92, modal:0.90, viscose:0.90
interaction_with_fit: Affects cling threshold modifiers (weight_mod) and structure volume calculations

visual_effect: Volume amplification on curved body zones
rule: Sheen score mapped from surface finish type. Interacts with curvature for volume effect. Crushed surfaces reduce curvature mapping to 25%.
scoring_formula: deep_matte:0.0, matte:0.10, subtle_sheen:0.25, moderate_sheen:0.50, high_shine:0.75, maximum_shine:1.0, crushed:0.35
interaction_with_fit: Sheen * curvature_factor * projection_mod * height_mod. Concave zones get negative factor. Dark+shiny compound flag.

visual_effect: Optimal fabric for curvy bodies - smooth drape without body-documenting conformity
rule: Rayon/nylon/elastane double knit (~300gsm, drape 5) is the sweet spot between cling (drape 7+) and projection (drape 3-). Recovery rate ~92%. Built-in smoothing layer.
scoring_formula: Ponte vs structured woven on plus-size: volume 0.30-0.46 advantage, smoothness 0.85 vs 0.30
interaction_with_fit: Climate limit: above 80F/27C uncomfortable. Alternative: polyester crepe (drape 5-6, ~180gsm).

rule: Standard reference for all scoring. Drape 4, GSM 120-160, Sheen 0.10, Stretch Low, Woven. Sweet spot for rectangle body type.
interaction_with_fit: All other fabrics scored relative to cotton poplin baseline

rule: Drape 6-7, GSM 150-200, Sheen 0.10, Stretch Medium, Knit. Sweet spot for casual wear on lean bodies.
scoring_formula: Moderate cling risk on curvy bodies due to drape 6-7
interaction_with_fit: High cling risk on hourglass/plus at drape 7

visual_effect: High sheen volume amplification - WARNING: Only safe on lean bodies
rule: Drape 8, GSM 80-120, Sheen 0.50, Stretch Low, Woven. DANGEROUS: high sheen + high drape + low weight = maximum cling + maximum specular highlighting on curves.
scoring_formula: Sheen 0.50 * curvature amplifier on any curved zone = significant volume addition
interaction_with_fit: Black satin on apple belly = the #1 most dangerous common advice failure (dark+shiny inversion)

rule: Drape 5-6, GSM 140-200, Sheen 0.15, Stretch Low-Med, Woven. Bridges apple belly. Ponte climate alternative.
scoring_formula: bridging_capacity at drape 5 = 0.8 inches; at drape 6 = 0 inches
interaction_with_fit: Better breathability than ponte in hot/humid climates while providing similar visual properties

visual_effect: Maximum cling risk with high sheen
rule: Drape 9, GSM 60-80, Sheen 0.55, Stretch Low, Woven. WARNING: High cling risk. Full body contact + high specular highlighting.
scoring_formula: Drape 9 + gsm 60-80 = floor_to_body contact. Sheen 0.55 on any curve = strong volume amplification.
interaction_with_fit: Silk surface friction modifier +6% on cling threshold (slides off body somewhat), but extremely low weight -12% overwhelms

visual_effect: Professional versatile fabric for all bodies
rule: Drape 4-5, GSM 200-280, Sheen 0.08, Stretch Low, Woven. Low sheen + moderate weight + moderate drape = safe for professional wear across all body types.
scoring_formula: Matte (0.08 sheen) suppresses highlights. Moderate drape (4-5) provides skim without cling.
interaction_with_fit: Universal professional recommendation. Low scoring variance across body types.
